title: How to Buy a Camera on eBay

steps.headline: Browse over the "Electronics" category on the eBay homepage and select "Cameras and Photo."
steps.description:
Here you can find subcategories related to photography, such as:
Camcorders
Camera and Photo Accessories
Digital Cameras
Film Cameras
Lenses and Filters
Video Production and Editing

steps.headline: Explore some of the subcategories by clicking on their links to see the items being sold.
steps.description: You will notice that most of the subcategories offer either equipment for professionals or accessories, but the "Digital Cameras" subcategory has cameras that are also suitable for common consumers (these types of cameras can usually be found at general electronics stores instead of only specialty photography shops). Therefore it is most likely that you will want to continue to buy a camera on eBay by selecting the "Digital Cameras" subcategory.

steps.headline: Select cameras from the items list to view their details and decide which camera you want to buy.
Open the details page of the camera that is your final choice and place a maximum bid that is higher than the current bid.
Go to the "My eBay" link at the top and select "Bids/Offers."
steps.description: You can use the Bids/Offers page to stay updated with the bidding. If someone outbids you then you must place another bid to beat theirs. You must continue to do this until you have won the item.

steps.headline: Look for the "Pay Now" button that appears on the listing of the camera after you won it.
steps.description: Press this button to choose your payment method and follow the on-screen instructions to complete the payment process.

steps.headline: Find out when your camera will be delivered to you by looking for the receipt in your email inbox.
steps.description: The receipt will have the approximate delivery date and confirmation of your payment.

text:
Getting to the Cameras Section Browse over the "Electronics" category on the eBay homepage and select "Cameras and Photo." Here you can find subcategories related to photography, such as:
Camcorders
Camera and Photo Accessories
Digital Cameras
Film Cameras
Lenses and Filters
Video Production and Editing Explore some of the subcategories by clicking on their links to see the items being sold. You will notice that most of the subcategories offer either equipment for professionals or accessories, but the "Digital Cameras" subcategory has cameras that are also suitable for common consumers (these types of cameras can usually be found at general electronics stores instead of only specialty photography shops). Therefore it is most likely that you will want to continue to buy a camera on eBay by selecting the "Digital Cameras" subcategory. Buying Cameras Select cameras from the items list to view their details and decide which camera you want to buy.  Open the details page of the camera that is your final choice and place a maximum bid that is higher than the current bid.  Go to the "My eBay" link at the top and select "Bids/Offers." You can use the Bids/Offers page to stay updated with the bidding. If someone outbids you then you must place another bid to beat theirs. You must continue to do this until you have won the item. Look for the "Pay Now" button that appears on the listing of the camera after you won it. Press this button to choose your payment method and follow the on-screen instructions to complete the payment process. Find out when your camera will be delivered to you by looking for the receipt in your email inbox. The receipt will have the approximate delivery date and confirmation of your payment.
